text: "Encore" is a 1983 R&B; hit single for popular R&B;/soul singer Cheryl Lynn. The song is written and produced by the highly successful Minneapolis funk duo, Jimmy Jam & Terry Lewis. Although the single peaked at #69 on the Hot 100, it was the duo's first number one R&B; hit as producers/writers and Lynn's second number one charting R&B; single. It is the opening track to her album Preppie. The song was also a popular dance track, reaching number six on the US Dance chart. ==Other versions== The following other versions were released * Encore (Dance Version) - 8:18 ==Charts== {| class="wikitable" !align="left"|Chart (1984) !align="center"|Peak position |- |align="left"|US Billboard Hot 100 |align="center"|69 |- |align="left"|US Billboard Hot Soul Singles |align="center"|1 |- |align="left"|US Billboard Hot Dance Club Songs |align="center"|6 |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:Cheryl Lynn songs Category:1983 songs Category:1983 singles Category:Billboard Hot R&B;/Hip-Hop Songs number- one singles Category:Songs written by Jimmy Jam and Terry Lewis Category:Song recordings produced by Jimmy Jam and Terry Lewis Category:Columbia Records singles
title: Encore (Cheryl Lynn song)
